body_content.explanation: consisting of or filled with vapour (= gas or extremely small drops of liquid that result from the heating of a liquid or solid):
examples: Condensation is the passage of a substance from the vaporous to the liquid state.
Every six months, the lab will be flushed with vaporous hydrogen peroxide to sterilize it.
I still have that vapory alcohol taste in my mouth.
In the painting, the sky seemed to rest lightly on the distant and vaporous outline of the hills.
The term "personalized learning" is so vaporous that it can mean anything you want it to mean.
She is an oddly vapory character - not especially clear or psychologically subtle.
